column2: COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. Entry requirements for Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
column3:
Quarantine Requirement- Unknown where. Entry requirements for Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
*Bonaire: All travellers should complete and submit a health declaration form, within 24 to 12 hours before departure. For further information, please see the website of the government of Bonaire.
*St Eustatius: There are no Covid-19 travel requirements for travel to St. Eustatius. More information can be found on the website of the government of St. Eustatius.
*Saba: There are no Covid-19 travel requirements for travel to Saba. More information can be found on the website of the government of Saba.
column4: You don’t need to provide your vaccination status for entry to Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba.
column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*All travellers:
*Bonaire: All travellers should complete and submit a health declaration form, within 24 to 12 hours before departure. For further information, please see the website of the government of Bonaire.
St Eustatius: There are no Covid-19 travel requirements for travel to St. Eustatius. More information can be found on the website of the government of St. Eustatius.
Saba: There are no Covid-19 travel requirements for travel to Saba. More information can be found on the website of the government of Saba. *If you’re fully vaccinated: Entry requirements for Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
Proof of vaccination status: You don’t need to provide your vaccination status for entry to Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba.
*If you’re not fully vaccinated: Entry requirements for Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
If you’ve had COVID-19 in the past year: Entry requirements for Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba are the same for all travellers, regardless of whether you have tested positive for COVID-19 in the past year.
*Children and young people: There are no specific requirements for children and young people.
*If you’re transiting through Bonaire, St Eustatius and Saba: Transiting is when you pass through one country on the way to your final destination. Check with your airline before departing.


Internal Restrictions:
*Public spaces and services: The governments of the BES islands have put measures in place in response to the coronavirus pandemic. Please see the below websites for the latest information:
• Bonaire: see the crisis website of the Government of Bonaire • St Eustatius: see the website of the Government of St. Eustatius • Saba: see the website of the Government of Saba
